resources.string: Kapi Language Learning

Present (Präsens)\n It is the present-conjugated form of the infinitive. It is the most important tense in German. The Present tense is mainly used for simple present, present progressive, as well as for future. It is also used for historical past.

Preterite (Imperfekt, Präteritum)\n It is the past-conjugated form of the infinitive. This past tense is mainly used in written German and formal speech, except for some frequent verbs whose preterite forms are common colloquially (such as ich war, ich hatte, ich kam). It is also used for past progressive. Otherwise the perfect is much preferred in the colloquial.

Perfect (Perfekt)\n It is the present-conjugated form of the perfect infinitive. This tense has (widely) the same meaning as the preterite, and very often replaces the latter in colloquial German. An English perfect tense is often expressed by the present in German. For example, \'I have lived in Germany for three years now.\' → Ich lebe jetzt seit drei Jahren in Deutschland. (Literally: \'I live now for three years in Germany.\')

Pluperfect / Past Perfect (Plusquamperfekt)\n It is the past-conjugated form of the perfect infinitive. It can be thought of as the perfect form of the Preterite, used to describe what already had happened at a certain point in the past. If the context is unambiguous, the perfect or preterite may be used instead (as in English).

Future (Futur I)\n It is the present-conjugated form of the future infinitive. It generally describes the future, but also expresses an assumption for the present. In contrast to English, the future tense is usually replaced by the present tense if the future meaning is already evident from the context.

Future Perfect (Futur II)\n It is the present-conjugated form of the future infinitive of the perfect infinitive. It describes what will have happened at a certain point in the future (past of the future), but the simple perfect, or even present (and by a not uncommon pupil mistake, Futur I, though that is universally judged incorrect), is preferred instead if the future meaning is evident from the context.
Prezent (Present)\n Verbs in the present tense express an action that takes place at the moment of speaking.

Perfect Simplu (Simple Perfect, Preterite)\n Outside of the region of Oltenia (in South-West Romania) this tense is not commonly used. In most parts of Romania, the Perfect compus (or compound perfect) is preferred. In places where the compus is preferred, when the simple perfect is used, it generally indicates that an action was completed in the very near past.
Imperfect (Imperfect)\n Verbs in imperfect tense express an unfinished action that takes place in the past from the moment of speaking.
Mai mult ca Perfect (Pluperfect)\n Verbs in pluperfect tense express a past action, performed before another past action.
Viitor I (Future)\n Verbs in the future tense express an action that will be performed after the moment of speaking.
Viitor 2 (Future Perfect)\n The future perfect is formed by using the above auxiliaries with fi and the past participle.
Viitor Popular 1 (Future Popular 1)\n The first type of popular future is formed simply by adding "o" to the subjunctive form of a verb.

Viitor Popular 2 (Future Popular 2)\n The second type of popular future is slightly more complicated than the first type. It is formed simply by adding the present tense form of avea to the subjunctive form of a verb.
Viitor în Trecut (Future in the past)\n The future in the past is formed with the imperfect tenses of avea (seen above) with the subjunctive form of a verb.
Presente (Present)\n This verb tense is used to talk about the present.
Pretérito Perfecto (Perfect)\n Verbs in perfect tense express completed actions which still influences the present.
Pretérito Imperfecto (Imperfect)\n Imperfect tense expresses a past action without a definite beginning or end, as well as the usual repetition of a past event..
Pretérito Indefinido (Preterite)\n Past tense is used for previous actions completed once or actions that interrupt another past action.
Pretérito Plusquamperfecto (Past Perfect)\n Past perfect is used to describe an action that took place before a certain point in the past.
Pretérito Anterior (Preterite Perfect)\n The perfect past tense is hard to use nowadays. It expresses something that happened shortly before another action.
Futuro Próximo (Future go + to)\n The future (ir + a) is often used instead of the simple future in spoken Spanish..
Futuro Simplo (Future Simple)\n The future tense is generally used to express an intention about the future or an assumption about the present or the future.
Futuro Compuesto (Future Perfect)\n The perfect future expresses the assumption or assumption that an action will be completed by the present moment or by a point in the future.

The German language (Deutsch) is a West Germanic language mainly spoken in Central Europe. It is the most widely spoken and official or co-official language in Germany, Austria, Switzerland, Liechtenstein, and the Italian province of South Tyrol. It is also a co-official language of Luxembourg, Belgium and parts of southwestern Poland, as well as a national language in Namibia.

The language known today as Spanish is derived from a dialect of spoken Latin, which was brought to the Iberian Peninsula by the Romans during the Second Punic War, beginning in 218 BC, and which evolved in central parts of the Iberian Peninsula after the fall of the Western Roman Empire in the fifth century. A written standard was developed in the cities of Toledo (13th to 16th centuries) and Madrid (from the 1560s).

Romanian is a Balkan Romance language spoken by approximately 24–26 million people as a native language, primarily in Romania and Moldova, and by another 4 million people as a second language. According to another estimate, there are about 34 million people worldwide who can speak Romanian, of whom 30 million speak it as a native language.
Open
Close

Ways to say hello in German:

Hallo = Hello
Guten Tag = Good day
Guten Morgen = Good morning
Guten Abend = Good evening


Ways to say goodbye in German:

Tschüss = goodbye
Ciao = Bye
Auf Wiedersehen = Farewell
Gute Nacht = Goodnight
Bis bald = See you soon


Personal Pronouns (=Personalpronomen):


Nominativ:

ich = I; du = you; er = he; sie = she; es = it; wir = we; ihr = them; sie = you; Sie = You (=Höflichkeitsform).


Nominativ:

meiner = mine; deiner = yours; seiner =his; ihrer = hers; seiner = its; unser = ours; euer = yours; ihrer = theirs.


Dativ:

mir = me;dir = you; ihm = him; ihr = her; ihm = it; uns = us; euch = you; ihnen = them; Ihnen = You (=Höflichkeitsform).


Akkusativ:

mich = me; dich = you; ihn = him; sie = her; es = it; uns = us; euch = you; sie = them; Sie = You (=Höflichkeitsform).


Adverbs of place(=Advierben des Ortes)

Wo? = Where?
Woher? = Where from?
Wohin? = Where to?


Adverbs of time(=Advierben der Zeit)

Wann? = When?
Wie lange? = How long?
Ab wann? = From when?
 Bis wann? = By when?


Causal adverbs(=Kausaladverbien)

Warum? = Why?
Weshalb? = For which reason?
Wieso? = How so?
Unter welcher Bedingung? = Under which condition?

Numbers

0 = null
1 = eins
2 = zwei
3 = drei
4 = vier
5 = fünf
6 = sechs

8 = acht

10 = zehn
11 = elf

13 = dreizehn
14 = vierzehn
15 = fünfzehn

18 = achtzehn
19 = neunzehn
20 = zwahnzig
21 = einundzwanzig

24 = vierundzwanzig
25 = fünfundzwanzig
26 = sechsundzwanzig

60 = sechzig
70 = siebzig
80 = achtzig
90 = neunzig
100 = hundert
200 = zweihundert
300 = dreihundert
252 = zweihundertdreiundfünfzig
1000 = tausend
2000 = zweitausend
3000 = dreitausend
3627 = dreitausendsechshundert siebenundzwanzig
10,000 = zehntausand
100,000 = hunderttausend
one Million = eine Million
one Billion = eine Milliarde

Time

die Stunden = the hours
die Stunde = the hour
Wie spät ist es? = What time is it?
Es is x Uhr. = It is x o’clock.
Halb = half
Viertel = quarter
nach = past
vor = to

When there is a full hour you must put the Uhr word at the end.
08:00
Es ist 8 Uhr. = It is 8 o’clock.
12:00
Es ist 12 Uhr. = It is 12 o’clock.

When there is not a full hour and there are minutes, you put the word Uhr between the hour and the minutes.
3:19
Es ist drei Uhr neunzehn. = It is three nineteen.
6:42
Es ist sechs Uhr zweiundvierzig. = It is six forty-two.

You can use the word nach to tell how many minutes have past the hour.
9:05
Es ist fünf nach neun. = It is five past nine.
2:10
Es ist zehn nach zwei. = It is ten past two.

The word vor can be used when you have less than 30 minutes to the next hour only.
4:50
Es ist zehn vor fünf. = It is ten to five.
7:31
Es ist neundundzwanzig vor acht. = It is twenty-nine to eight

When there is only quarter left or only a quarter has past, you can use the word viertel.
3:45
Es ist viertel vor vier = It is quarter to four
1:15
Es ist viertel nach ein. = It is quarter past one.

When you have only 30 minutes left to the next hour you can use the word halb, but you must add the next hour.
8:30
Es ist halb neun. = It is half past eight.
2:30
Es ist halb drei. = It is half past two.

Days of the week

Montag = Monday
Dienstag = Tuesday
Mittwoch = Wednesday
Donnerstag = Thursday
Freitag = Friday
Samstag = Saturday
Sonntag = Sunday 


The months

Januar = January
Februar = February

April = April

Juni = June
Juli = July
August = August
September = September
Oktober = October
November = November

The seasons

Frühling = Spring
Sommer = Summer
Herbst = Autumn
Winter = Winter

Ways to say hello in Romanian:

Bună! = Hello!
Bună ziua! = Good day!
Bună dimineața! = Good morning!
Bună seara! = Good evening!


Ways to say goodbye in Romanian:

La revedere! = Goodbye!
Pa pa! = Bye Bye!
Rămas bun! = Farewell!
Noapte bună! = Goodnight
Pe curând! = See you soon!


Personal Pronouns (=Pronumele personale):


Nominativ:

eu = I; tu = you; el = he; ea = she; el/ea = it; noi = we; voi = you; ei = them; voi(politețe) = You.


Genitiv:

al meu = mine; al tău = yours; al lui = his; al ei = hers; al ei/al lui = its; al nostru = ours; al vostru = yours; al lor = theirs.


Dativ:

mie = me; ție = you; lui = him; ei = her; lui/ei = it; nouă = us; vouă = you; lor = them.


Acuzativ:

pe mine = me; pe tine = you; pe el = him; pe ea = her; pe el/pe ea = it; pe noi = us; pe voi = you; pe ei/ele = them; pe dumneavostră = on You.


Adverbs of place(=Adverbe de loc)

Unde? = Where?
De unde? = Where from?
Încotro? = Where to?


Adverbs of time(=Adverbe de timp)

Când? = When?
Cât de mult = How long?
De când? = From when?
Până când? = By when?


Causal adverbs(=Adverbe de cauză)

De ce? = Why?
Cu ce scop? = For which reason?
Cum așa? = How so?
Cu ce condiție? = Under which condition?

1000 = o mie
2000 = două mii

10,000 = zece mii
100,000 = o sută de mii
one Million = un milion
one Billion = un miliard

Time

Ore = hours
Oră = hour
Cât este ceasul? = What time is it?
Este ora x fix. = It is x o’clock.
jumătate = half
sfert = quarter

08:00
Este ora 8. = It is 8 o’clock.
12:00
Este ora 12. = It is 12 o’clock.

3:19
Este ora trei și nouăsprezece minute. = It is three nineteen.
6:42
Este ora șase și patruzeci și două de minute. = It is six forty-two.

9:05
Este ora nouă și cinci minute. = It is five past nine.
2:10
Este ora două și zece minute. = It is ten past two.

4:50
Este ora patru și cincizeci de minute. = It is ten to five.
7:31
Este ora șapte și treizeci și unu de minute. = It is twenty-nine to eight

3:45
Este ora patru fără un sfert. = It is quarter to four
1:15
Este ora unu și un sfert. = It is quarter past one.

8:30
Este ora opt și jumătate. = It is half past eight.
2:30
Este ora două și jumătate. = It is half past two.

Days of the week

Luni = Monday
Marți = Tuesday
Miercuri = Wednesday
Joi = Thursday
Vineri = Friday
Sâmbătă = Saturday
Duminică = Sunday 


The months

Ianuarie = January
Februarie = February

Ways to say hello in Spanish:

Hola! = Hello!
Buenas tardes! = Good day!
Buenos días = Good morning!
Buenas noches! = Good evening!


Ways to say goodbye in Spanish:

Adiós! = Goodbye!
¡Nos vemos! = See you!
¡Nos vemos pronto! = See you soon!
¡Hasta luego! = See you later!
Buenas noches! = Goodnight!
¡Qué tengas un buen día! = Have a good day!


Personal Pronouns (=pronombres personales):


Nominativo:
\yo = I; tú = you; él = he; él = she; ella = it; nosotros = we; vosotros = you; ellos/ellas/ustedes = them.


Genitivo:

(el) mío/ (la) mía = mine; (el) tuyo/(la) tuya = yours; (el) suyo = his; (el) suyo/(la) suya = hers; (el) nuestro/(la) nuestra = ours; (el) vuestro/(la) vuestra = yours; (el)suyo/(la)suyo = theirs.


Dativo:

me = me;te = you; le = him; le = her; le = it; nosotros = us; vosotros = you; ellos/ellas/ustedes = them.


Acusativo:

me = me; te = you; lo = him; la = her; lo = it; nos = us; os = you; los/las/los = them.


Adverbs of place(=adverbios de lugar)

¿Dónde? = Where?
¿De donde? = Where from?
Hasta donde?? = Where to?


Adverbs of time(=adverbios de tiempo)

¿Cuándo? = When?
¿Cuánto cuesta? = How long?
¿Desde? = From when?
¿Hasta que? = By when?


Causal adverbs(=adverbios de causa)

¿Por qué? = Why?
¿Con qué propósito? = For which reason?
¿Cómo es eso? = How so?
¿En qué condición? = Under which condition?

Time

horas = hours
hora = hour
¿Qué hora es? = What time is it?
Son X en punto. = It is x o’clock.
mitad = half
trimestre = quarter

08:00
Son las ocho en punto. = It is 8 o’clock.
12:00
Son las doce en punto. = It is 12 o’clock.

3:19
Son las tres y diecinueve. = It is three nineteen.
6:42
Son las seis cuarenta y dos minutos. = It is six forty-two.

9:05
Son las nueve y cinco minutos. = It is five past nine.
2:10
Son las diez y dos minutos. = It is ten past two.

4:50
Son las cuatro y cincuenta. = It is ten to five.
7:31
Son las siete y treinta y un minutos. = It is twenty-nine to eight

3:45
Son las tres cuarenta y cinco minutos. = It is quarter to four
1:15
Es la una y quince minutos. = It is quarter past one.

8:30
Son las ocho y media. = It is half past eight.
2:30
Son las dos y treinta. = It is half past two.
